content: @Vlad Korobov how does #22419 look?

Screenshot-from-2022-09-02-23-12-17.png

Might be fixed by giving the date dividers the same treatment?

Though I guess that's tricky because in general they might be between messages that have different recipients and so don't share a recipient header and accompanying left line.

Hm, I wanted to post a screenshot of the direction we're going in with the background colors, but I guess https://github.com/zulip/zulip/issues/21750#issue-1198823513 doesn't illustrate date dividers. @Vlad Korobov maybe you could share an up-to-date screenshot of what we're working towards for dark theme?
Was there a page background color change that was supposed to be bundled with this message background color change? Brown on dark blue really doesn’t work at all.
(I guess it’s not even really brown, it just looks that way optically.)
Here's the dark-mode screenshot from the comment Alya linked: image.png
So that one changes the page background to no longer blue, and instead a similar hue to the message background color.

Anders Kaseorg said:

Was there a page background color change that was supposed to be bundled with this message background color change? Brown on dark blue really doesn’t work at all.

The plan was to try changing the message background separately from the app background. It seems to be working for light theme (at least to my eyes so far), but perhaps we won't be able to do that for dark theme.
I feel like this dark mode color is a lot greener or browner than most of the usual dark mode colors. Is there a specific reason for this, maybe related to ergonomic studies?
I personally love the hover behaviour on messages -- it feels familiar from other chat apps, and also helps me find my mouse :)

I feel like this dark mode color is a lot greener or browner than most of the usual dark mode colors. Is there a specific reason for this, maybe related to ergonomic studies?

The actual background is not colorized in any way.. there is no chroma in it: image.png
But you brain takes the whole picture, which has topic title colorization + right column with green online statuses and makes you feel like the theme has some color
The background color of PMs has warm color in it.

Vlad Korobov said:

The actual background is not colorized in any way.. there is no chroma in it: image.png
But you brain takes the whole picture, which has topic title colorization + right column with green online statuses and makes you feel like the theme has some color

Yeah, that makes sense :) And I think that I'm in the progress of getting accustomed to the new color ^^
[When I first saw it, I thought for a moment "oh no, I'm not deploying this" :joy: But it just looks a bit odd currently because we don't have the complete new color scheme yet. Finally, this could look quite nice :thumbs_up: ]
For @-mentions, the new background color (in light mode) is pretty subtle. Just now I was catching up on a conversation and I nearly missed that it had an @-mention for me.
It looks like it's a pale blue that's just a little bit deeper than the one seen on hover.

The new pale blue is definitely more soothing, and blends in more with the rest of the page, than the salmon-pink color we've been using.

But given the purpose of this feature, it's important that it visually stand out. I think even having a color that's a bit jarring may be a good thing here -- intruding into the user's attention is the point.
Yeah, I had the same concern that the mention color was too subtle -- as noted above, it's pretty close to the hover color in terms of its contrast.
@Evy is it easy to fix the date dividers to have the same background as the messages? I assume that was the design intent; we can deal with changing their content in an independent pass.

Just to clarify, this bit of background between messages is okay in the interleaved view right? We're only concerned about the styling while in a topic/PM narrow?

image.png
I think that's what we want, but also that means that the date divider shouldn't have its colour changed in the interleaved view right now (in my opinion, at least).

with this CSS

I can get this, which seems reasonable
But I don't think we want this
Let me know! And I can likely make it happen :)

Judging colors is pretty hard if there is no other contextual colors are implemented.
image.png
The main anchor for the eye is color of the pill itself.
PMs are also pretty hard to miss if there is a proper header image.png
I suggest we get back to tuning colors once we implement all aspects of them in the message feed
We can always increase some vibrance here and there. It is pretty easy. What's hard is the balance between visible and annoying for everyday use.

That's helpful context, thanks.

Vlad Korobov said:

The main anchor for the eye is color of the pill itself.

I guess we can see how this looks when we have that part implemented. But from that mockup screenshot, my reaction is: I feel like it'd be pretty easy for me to miss an @-mention there.

Sometimes there's a lot of text in a conversation, and when it's not obviously relevant to me I appreciate that Zulip makes it easy for me to skim through it quickly. When I do, having the whole message highlighted does a lot to help me notice that I should look at that message more closely, and then I find the @-mention.
So you want more vibrant background for a message with your mention?

@Evy agreed about the date dividers in your screenshots, though I think the definition is not exactly about interleaved vs. non-interleaved views. You can have an interleaved view with a date divider inside a message block, and then it should have its background matching the messages around it, same as in non-interleaved views.
I haven't personally had trouble noticing mentions, but I'd be open to trying out making them a bit more visible.

Vlad Korobov said:

So you want more vibrant background for a message with your mention?

Yep, exactly.
#22419 has been updated with the dark-mode fix.

Cool, updating that deployment (and I also merged the larger preparatory commit as 3f66a9ef2bd5ab38ced2d11640a0ba899f82e347).

I suppose we should probably open a refactoring/API issue for adding support for passing whether a mention was via a group to clients via the API. It's not an immediate priority, but it'd be nice to have it before mobile tries to implement a similar design change.
I've deployed the updated version here just now.

@Greg Price and @Evy let me know what do you think about that.
I'm comparing highlight colors here:
image.png
I put updated vibrant colors next to hover message color. In the area of 4 squares all perceived lightness values are different, so all kind of color blind people can detect the difference:
image.png

Here is the comparison inside the app image.png
Great, I'm glad you're making it color-blind friendly :)
I don't actually have much of a preference for color/brightness/etc. I already feel like it's clear enough to me (in lightmode) and I think I'd also be comfortable with something brighter.

In the last screenshot, the message in the middle, with the teal background, looks conspicuous enough to signal a mention for me.

I don't think I'm following what all the different colors in that screenshot are meant to signify, though.
I think that screenshot shows new vs. updated colors alongside each other. In general, yellow = PM, purple = personal mentions, teal = group mentions.
I'd be happy to try the updated version.
Have we decided on what the next set of colors should be? Once I have a full list, I can do an update. @Vlad Korobov

@Evy lets try to improve light theme by having hovers with 3% opacity.
PM highlight color hsla(45, 44%, 95%, 1)
User mention highlight color hsla(240, 52%, 95%, 1)
Group mention highlight color hsla(180, 40%, 94%, 1)

Updates to #22419

  • light mode PM highlight color hsl(45, 44%, 95%)
  • light mode User mention highlight color hsl(240, 52%, 95%)
  • light mode Group mention highlight color hsl(180, 40%, 94%)
  • light mode hover adds hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.03); over the messagebox
  • dark mode PMs hsl(47, 20%, 14%) as requested through PMs with Vlad

Let me know if you want any more updates!

Was there a page background color change that was supposed to be bundled with this message background color change? Brown on dark blue really doesn’t work at all.

  1. The message color change isn't working without the background color change.
  2. We think the message color change might be fine once the background color change is implemented.

@Vlad Korobov :

can we try to make animation on hover? And increase a bit exit from hover animation time?

make fade in like fade out now, make fade out x2 longer than fade out now

This is a pretty substantial regression for usability, so I hope we can revert it soon.

(I figure this is an implementation bug somewhere -- IIUC we haven't contemplated an intentional design choice of wiping out that distinction.)

#22419 is now updated with (1) fixing the bug Anders brought up (2) transition in and out of hover (3) separating the light and dark theme changes into two commits
I'm a bit worried that the hover colors aspect of this are distracting more than helpful, at least for me.
Should we try losing the 0.4 delay in showing the background color?

Quoting Neil Pilgrim (neiljp)'s comment from another thread:

Neil Pilgrim (neiljp) said:

Is the message hover color more distinct now? I was just reading (navigating using keys) and wondered what was happening, since some messages had a gray background that I wasn't expecting (that was rather badly rendering when I moved up/down, a different issue?).

My assumption was that messages 'off center', or not fully visible in the message list, were shaded darker - but it turned out this was simply since my pointer was a little way below the topic header!

Can this be done dynamically, so the hover color fades in/out when the mouse is moved/moving?

If we can make the hover effect disappear when you navigate by keyboard, and reappear when you move the mouse again, I think that'd be helpful.
Is there CSS that handles that case easily?

Tim Abbott said:

I'm a bit worried that the hover colors aspect of this are distracting more than helpful, at least for me.

I agree, and it feels like it can easily get buggy.

I'm about 50/50 between mouse scrolling and keyboard scrolling, and the hover does seem to get stuck, at least temporarily, in a non-intuitive place for me when I switch modes (which I think is what Greg is alluding to).

Evy said:

Is there CSS that handles that case easily?

My understanding is browser APIs don't offer an easy way to write code to distinguish between scrolls triggered in different ways -- what we'd need to do is something that stores state when starting the keyboard-initiated scroll and keeps track of that.

If we can make the hover effect disappear when you navigate by keyboard, and reappear when you move the mouse again, I think that'd be helpful.

It's not just keyboard scrolling, but any keyboard nav, I think. I just had a "why is some random message lightly greyed out?" moment when navigating from topic to topic with n.
I think it's important to figure something out here.
The more distracting thing to me, more than the message background, is the sending user's name flashing blue as I move the mouse vertically up and down the message list.

e.g.

The more distracting thing to me, more than the message background, is the sending user's name flashing blue as I move the mouse vertically up and down the message list.

That part just seems like a bug? I don't recall that in any of the designs, and it's not described in #22059. (I don't know if it comes from #22419 or not.)

I actually surprising like the message background, I find it easier to focus and read a message with it. There is definitely that moment where we find it weird that a message is lightly greyed out but I feel like the main confusion really comes from having two different message selectors; Especially when they're both highlighting different messages.

Alya Abbott said:

Ah yeah that's a bug! I don't think it came from the same PR, but it seems good to fix.

Yeah this seems like an issue of trying to make a nice experience for both keyboard and mouse users. I find the hover behavior helpful (and expected, similar to other apps) and I'd prefer the blue box go away when I'm moving my mouse around, but we have a lot of functionality that rely on some message always being selected by the blue box.

It's possible to reach the same state on Slack if you start by moving between messages with the keyboard. Here one message is selected by keyboard and another is selected by mouse.

image.png

(Though I think that's also not great)

I'm not sure what the best solution is for mouse users. We could hide the blue box when doing hover effects (and treat the hovered message as the blue rectangle message) but we'd probably want to bring the blue rectangle back once the mouse is no longer hovering on a message. Which might look weird, and implementing that all also might be tricky.

Ah yeah that's a bug! I don't think it came from the same PR, but it seems good to fix.

Yeah, this issue is in main, so it's not related to #22419. I think the bug here is that we used to have the blue hover behavior just for the name (since clicking on it opens the user card), but now the hover target is the entire row. @Aman (amanagr) FYI
